lcInstruction.p: Simple tables (<simpletable>) use the following elements to represent and organize tabular data:

strow.stentry: There can be at most one header row.
There must be at least one body row, but the table can contain many rows.
Each row can contain one or more <stentry> elements, but each row (including the header row) should include the same number of <stentry> elements.

lcInstruction.note: This table is built using a <simpletable> element.
lcInstruction.p: The <stentry> element can contain text data or other common block and inline elements.
Here is an example of a table with one heading row, two body rows, and two columns.
lcInstruction.pre: <simpletable> <sthead> <stentry>heading for column 1</stentry> <stentry>heading for column 2</stentry> </sthead> <strow> <stentry>row 1, column 1</stentry> <stentry>row 1, column 2</stentry> </strow> <strow> <stentry>row 2, column 1</stentry> <stentry>row 2, column 2</stentry> </strow> </simpletable>
